text.section:
Except as provided in subsections (b), (c), and (e) of this section, the Center is exempt from:
Title 10 and Division II of the State Finance and Procurement Article; and
§§ 10-505 and 10-507 of the State Government Article.
The Center is subject to the Public Information Act.
The Board and the officers and employees of the Center are subject to the Public Ethics Law.
The officers and employees of the Center are not subject to the provisions of Division I of the State Personnel and Pensions Article that govern the State Personnel Management System.
The Center, its Board, and employees are subject to Title 12, Subtitle 4 and Title 14, Subtitle 3 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
